bill.title: An act relating to firearms procedures
bill.description: An act relating to firearms procedures

history.action: Committee bill read first time & placed on Notice Calendar per Senate Rule 48
Committee Bill for Second Reading
Committee Bill for Second Reading
Recommendation of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Sears
Recommendation of amendment to be offered by Senator(s) Rodgers
Read 2nd time
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Sears, text
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Rodgers, text
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Recommendation of amendment by Senator(s) Collamore, text
Recommendation of amendment disagreed to
Roll Call, requested by Senator Baruth, Failed -- Needed 16 of 30 to Pass -- Yeas = 10, Nays = 20
3rd reading ordered on roll call, requested by Senator Sears, Passed -- Needed 16 of 30 to Pass -- Yeas = 20, Nays = 10
New Business/Third Reading
Pending third reading, motion to amend to be offered by Senator(s) McNeil
Pending third reading, motion to amend bill offered by Senator(s) McNeil
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Pending third reading, motion to amend bill offered by Senator(s) Sears
Recommendation of amendment agreed to
Read 3rd time & passed
Read First Time and Referred to the Committee on Judiciary
Read Second Time
Rep. LaLonde of South Burlington reported for the committee on Judiciary
Rep. Savage of Swanton moved to propose to the Senate to amend the bill
Rep. Savage of Swanton asked and was granted leave to withdraw amendment
Rep. Brennan of Colchester moved to propose to the Senate to amend the bill
Which was disagreed to
Rep. McFaun of Barre Town, Anthony of Barre City, and LaClair of Barre Town moved to propose to the Senate to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 69 of 137 to Pass -- Yeas = 56, Nays = 81
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Bancroft of Westford moved to propose to the Senate to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 70 of 139 to Pass -- Yeas = 50, Nays = 89
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Brennan of Colchester moved to propose to the Senate to amend the bill
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 72 of 142 to Pass -- Yeas = 49, Nays = 93
Which was disagreed to
Rep. Donahue of Northfield moved to commit the bill to the committee on Health Care
Roll Call Results Failed -- Needed 71 of 140 to Pass -- Yeas = 46, Nays = 94
Which was disagreed to
Roll Call Results Passed -- Needed 71 of 140 to Pass -- Yeas = 82, Nays = 58
Third Reading Ordered
Read Third time and Passed in Concurrence
House message House passed bill in concurrence
As passed by Senate and House
Delivered to Governor on June 4, 2019
Governor vetoed bill on June 10, 2019
Senate message, Vetoed by Governor June 10, 2019
